title: Sample, mid-20th century
medium:
Medium: cotton, paper cord, aluminum strips
Technique: double-faced complimentary weft twill
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 31.1 x 44.1 cm (12 1/4 x 17 3/8 in.)
description: Handwoven sample in a checkerboard of tan and silver rectangles.  The warp is of white cotton, used in pairs.  One weft set is aluminum strips and the other tan paper cord.  Each weft appears on the surface in broad weft twill, with the complementary weft similarly bound on the reverse; patterning is created by the interchange of the two weft sets.

exhibitions.title: Josef and Anni Albers: Designs for Living

tombstone.epitaph:
Sample, mid-20th century.
mid-20th century. Medium: cotton, paper cord, aluminum strips
Technique: double-faced complimentary weft twill. Gift of Anni Albers. 1953-208-1.
